snippet: A new derivatives deal falls short of what’s needed to protect American taxpayers and the global economy from the calamitous effects of reckless bank trades.
abstract: Editorial holds Gary Gensler, chairman of Commodity Futures Trading Commission, got the best deal he could, when commission agreed on new rules regulating international derivative trades but argues it falls short of what is needed to protect global economy; allows deal will force domestic banks and funds into compliance with Dodd-Frank but warns international affiliates will still be allowed to trade recklessly.
lead_paragraph: A new derivatives deal falls short of what’s needed to protect American taxpayers and the global economy from the calamitous effects of reckless bank trades.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
